description:
Manual games allow you to set custom check locations and custom item names that will be rolled into a multiworld.
This allows any variety of game -- PC, console, board games, Microsoft Word memes... really anything -- to be part of a multiworld randomizer.
The key component to including these games is some level of manual restriction. Since the items are not actually withheld from the player,
the player must manually refrain from using these gathered items until the tracker shows that they have been acquired or sent.

v1.2.0.description:
Back-end files updated to be compatible with Manual Stable - 20250714

Other updates:

- Starting on NewGamePlus now starts you with a random weapon! Since the merchant is the first interaction upon starting a new round, you may buy whichever weapon you start with. Fresh save runs still only start with the Handgun.

- Reclassified some weapon's category to prevent them from being in the random starting pool.

- - This includes the Special Rocket Launcher from the final Saddler fight.
- - All grenades are now classified as Single Use Weapon
- - Weapon stocks and scopes are now classified as Weapon Enhancement
- Fixed an issue with Memo not showing up in the location list when connected.
v1.2.0.title: Resident Evil 4 (2005) Manual APWorld v1.2.0

v2.0.0r2.description:
The overhaul is done and finally here!

- Compatible with AP v0.6.3 and Manual 20250813.

New and Updated Features:

- Region logic overhauled to properly connect chapters and playthrough based on enabled game modes.
- - For NG+, some location logic now accounts for having either the Infinite Launcher or Handcannon enabled.

- Rewrite of existing "-sanity" options to split some location groupings into individual checks (i.e. "Crows" are no longer a single check, but rather each crow are their own.

- All "-sanity" options are now split between main story and Separate Ways.

- "Merchant Sidequests" now include the 24 bottle caps from the shooting range minigames in addition to the 15 blue medallions.

- Item pool total expanded and updated to reduce the vast amounts of "Plaga Virus" filler.

- New Game Plus players now start with a random weapon in addition to any post-game weapon of their choosing.

Split "-sanity" & new location totals:

- Herbs in main story adds 189 locations.
- - Separate Ways an additional 44 locations.

- Treasures in main story adds 330 locations.
- - Separate Ways an additional 80 locations.

- Cratesanity for main story adds 470 locations.
- - Separate Ways an additional 199 locations.

- Animalsanity in main story adds 110 locations.
- - Separate Ways an additional 16 locations.

- Addition of "Ammosanity" adds 482 locations to main story.
- - Separate Ways an additional 141 locations.

- Addition of "Memosanity" adds 23 locations to main story.
- - Hunnigan transmissions and player manuals are not included.
v2.0.0r2.title: Resident Evil 4 (2005) Manual APWorld v2.0.0

v2.0.1.description:
Following fixes for logic and generation:

- Added missing `region: Final Chapter` to Saddler's final fight.

- Reclassified grenades as normal items.
- - Mercenaries stages no longer require them to be in logic.

Updated some location text for clarity.
v2.0.1.title: Resident Evil 4 (2005) Manual APWorld v2.0.1

v2.0.2.description: Fixed incorrect formatting in `regions.json` causing generation to fail.
v2.0.2.title: Resident Evil 4 (2005) Manual APWorld v2.0.2

v2.0.3.description: Fixed region name for a selection of Separate Ways cratesanity checks.
v2.0.3.title: Resident Evil 4 (2005) Manual APWorld v2.0.3

v2.0.4.description:
Logic updated to now force herbs and treasures as location checks to prevent restrictive starts and causing generation failures.
- This is effective for both main story and Separate Ways.
v2.0.4.title: Resident Evil 4 (2005) Manual APWorld v2.0.4

v2.0.5.description: Fixed a typo with victory conditions still having old yaml configurations, resulting in goal being incorrectly available early if Separate Ways and/or Mercenaries were enabled.
v2.0.5.title: Resident Evil 4 (2005) Manual APWorld v2.0.5

v2.0.6.description: Adjusted yaml options to exclude Separate Ways sanity options if set to true while Separate Ways is set to false.
v2.0.6.title: Resident Evil 4 (2005) Manual APWorld v2.0.6

v2.0.7.description:
Fix logic for locations in chapter 1-3 missing the "Insignia Key" requirement after the region rewrite.

Also adjusted the yaml to include deathlink, which had been implemented since v2.0.0
v2.0.7.title: Resident Evil 4 (2005) Manual APWorld v2.0.7
